{"step_by_step_thinking": "X chromosome inactivation is a process that occurs in female mammals in which one of the two X chromosomes is inactivated. The purpose of this is to prevent an overabundance of X-linked gene products. However, some genes, known as escape genes, are not inactivated. CXorf21 is one of these genes that escape X chromosome inactivation.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
